reviews.review:
Summary: [i]If you haven't purchased this game yet...[url=store.steampowered.com/app/8870/]DO IT NOW[/url][/i]

I think that very few words can truly describe the amazing game that is Bioshock Infinite. It is, by far, the best game FPS I have ever played! I could go on for hours telling you about all the things that make Infinite such a ridiculously amazing game, so I will leave the body of my review down below. I would recommend this game to everyone I know. I love the game, the world of Columbia, and I am most impressed with Infinite.

Fluid game mechanics, excellent character development and a solid virtual environment all serve to transport the gamer into the world of Columbia. In contrast to the original two Bioshock games, Infinite maintains a more light-hearted and less stygian atmosphere throughout the game. The introduction of character-to-character interaction leads the user to understand the plot, goals, and underlying motives of each and [i]every[/i] character.

The NPC's of columbia stand out with unique personalities and attitudes during the game. They help the player comphrehend the attitudes of other game characters by presenting him/her with these multiple perspectives. For instance, the early NPC's of Columbia introduce topics, like the Vox Populi, which are not fully explained until halfway through the game. Some may argue that this is counterproductive, but I believe it holds some strategic merit. 
Oh, and the Lutece Twins, my favorite side characters from Infinite, are exceptional examples of how game characters can really connect to the player! After all, they "are where [they] are needed and needed where [they] are"...
Einfach nur geil
Отличный шикарный паропанк-антиутопия с со своими альтернативными реальностями

My lord. This was amazing! Bioshock infinite has one of the most detailed games I have seen in a long time. From the graphics, to the complex storyline, and the amazing music throughout the game you will be in pure shock in how good of a quality game this is! If you are into amazing story line games then this is your game! 10/10 WILL PLAY AGAIN!
Amazing story, favorite single player campaign so far....

The storyline in BioShock: Infinite is utterly fantastic and made this GOTY 2013 for me hands down.  I will admit, i got a little glassy eyed a few times as the story unfolded in the last portion of the game.  Lots a of cool references to prior BioShock games are tucked away throughout for those paying close attention.  I also enjoyed the DLC "Burial At Sea" and look forward to part 2.  I wonder whats next for the BioShock franchise... things could go so many directions at this point it will be interesting to see what Ken Levine has in store for the new console generation in the coming years.  SO in conclusion, if you are a BioShock fan and havent played this yet, PLAY IT NOW.  Its the best in the series thus far and should not be missed.  Also play NOW if your a general shooter fan.

Le plus abouti de la série, avec son lot de surprise. Mais même sans être cette fois coincé dans les couloirs de Rapture, cela reste très très linéaire et dirigiste... Le prix à payer pour jouer à une histoire et pas à un simple fps.

Loved every minute except for the very end.  By very end I mean VERY END, like very last scene.  That sucked.  Everything else was awesome.  Good story, graphics look great even on mid-level settings.  Gameplay is smooth.
Amazing, I absolutley love this game

A swashbuckling adventure!! Set pieces are beautiful, combat is fun, story is deep and kind of complex. The only beef I have is that Elizibeth might make things too convenient, she is always handing you things in two to three minute intervals it seems, which at time can seem redundant given the fact there are usually vendors around each new area. In my opinion it takes away a sense of urgency when you are running low on ammo money or otherwise, and I think in turn makes things easier than what they need to be.

Story is very shallow
it would be okay if it didn't get talked to be the citizen kane of video games, it wasn't that good

If you are a fan of the Bioschock series, or a newcomer this game will have you floored from the beginning. It is non-stop and makes you want to keep playing until the very end. If you could play a movie, this would be it! 

As I type this I just finished my first play-through and not only are the graphics stunning, the setting marvelous and the story line epic, but the game gives you chills multiple times throughout. 

This is one game you MUST add to your collection!

Bioshock Infinite should be considered the true sequel to the original Bioshock. the story will have you hoocked from the begining. the AI for Elizabeth is awsome. since once on the beach of battle ship bay the AI fully takes over all of her interactions between her and other NPC's. Booker Dewitt and Elizabeth just work, their "true" relationship they have will blow you away by the end of the game. Maxing out the settings shows the games true colors and showcases the developers work.

If you even remotly liked the original Bioshock pick this game up you will not regret it.
Uma experiencia unica para um FPS

Bioshock Infinite is a must have for any pc gamer. If you want to fully engage yourself in this amazing cinematic masterpiece that is Bioshock Infinite, do yourself a favor and get the game. The story alone is worth the price for this game.

The gameplay is simple and fluid, weapons and plasmids are interesting and has its purpose. Zipping through the world of Columbia on the sky hook is so fun and badass.
The music and sound design is fantastic, it really pulls you in to the world of Columbia.
The voice acting in this game is by far the best I've heard in any other story driven game.
The graphics is something that really make the game stand out. The amount of detail on buildings and roads look fantastic. The visuals in this game is truely immersive. 


Do you have to play the original bioshock 1 & 2 to understand the game? No. 
Will you enjoy Bioshock Infinite without any experience of Bioshock 1 & 2? Yes!

The game was a fun experience overall. However the combat gameplay became a little tiring (only so many arena style battles you can do) especially when you can easily blast your way through without needing to use the diversity of attacks/attack styles available. 

I finished the game mostly because the art design was so wonderful and because of its mysterious storyline. I really wanted to know the connection behind the main characters and the city of Columbia but there were times when I felt the pacing was a little too slow. 

My recommendation is to play it over the course of a few days/nights otherwise you might leave and not feel inclined to return with so many other worthwhile games out there.

I beat the game on the 360 and now I'm playing it on pc where you can really see it's beauty. It has an extremly intersesting campaign, well-though out characters, great gunplay, and the visuals are astonishing.

Bioshock Infinite is a flawed gem.... but while there are many issues with the game, in the end it is a title that every gamer should have as a part of their library and play through at least once.  The storytelling, central themes, and characters (especially Elizabeth) are all a cut above what most AAA games dare to attempt, and as such this is an important and powerful game in a genre that is traditionally loaded with juvenille pap.  

Mild spoilers ahead.

If you're looking for a solid shooter and couldn't give a hoot about a game that attempts to tackle some tough themes, then by all means go and pick up the latest Call of Duty game, however if you're interested in seeing the Video Game Industry actually try to tackle social issues like racism and poverty, or cerebral issues like parallel universes or time loops, then the Bioshock games - and especially Bioshock Infinite - are an amazing place to start.

As far as actual game play goes, Infinite is nothing special - if you've played a previous Bioshock then you know what to expect: your characters spends 50% of his time pouring bullets or psychic powers into waves of generally brainless AI pawns, and 50% of his time scouring through trash cans looking for rotting food to eat, or ammo to restock his arsenal.  The shooting is Fine.... but it's not really the point.  (And some might argue that there is too much of it, and it gets in the way of the really interesting stuff - namely the story.)

Special mention has to be made of Elizabeth, your "sidekick" in the game... she joins you a quarter of the wway into the main plot, and if you don't end up fallign in love at least a little bit with her, then you're a cold-hearted person indeed.  The game designers clearly wanted the player to emphasize with Elizabeth, and by my estimation they knocked it right out of the park.

All in all, Bioshock Infinite is a "Must Play" game, and you're doing yourself a disservice if you havent' given it a try yet.
Emotional Game Of The Year! A Must Play For 2013 Gamers!

Best story line of any game I have ever played. Also amazing gameplay.

This game is great, just get it. I could go on, but there really is no need to. I have not even finished the game and i can tell you that it is one of the best FPS I have ever played. The graphics are great, the story is compelling, the music is wondeful. My most memorable moment by far is when you are at the very start if the game and the floating stage comes by with the Barbershop Quartet singing "God Only Knows" by the beach boys. That moment alone was worth the $10 I payed for this game! 

So like I said if you are on the fence, just buy it.

1/8/14 Finished the game and the ending was really thought provoking and well put together. I just sat in shock while watching the credits! Bioshock Infinite illicited an emotional responses in my mind similar to a good book or movie. I have seen a lot of reviews saying that the story was convoluted and hard to follow but I did not have that problem.  If you are the type of person that skips cut-scences and just wants to blow stuff up this might not be the game for you, although you can do that in this game, I think the story is what made it.
Muss man gespielt haben

One of those games it's hard to stop playing. The environments and visuals and sound are all so well done, I always wanted to see what was around the next corner. The shooting/combat is good enough but not great. The characters are well done but you probably won't feel attached to them like in the first Bioshock.  Story had a lot of cool ideas in it and felt satisfying by the end.

게임의 대중적 인기에 큰 영향을 미치는 요소들, 즉 그래픽 스토리. 그리고 꼭 꼭 확보되지 않으면 안되는 요소들, 특히 FPS에서는 타격감,  각종 에러들. 이러한 것들이 모두 잘 갖추어져있고 또한 매력적이다. 또 실험적으로 새로운 플레이 패턴을 만들어내는 것과 이를 성공적으로 만들어 낸 점이  매우 인상깊다.. 이 모든 것이 잘 버무려져 잘 구성되어 큰 만족과 감동을 준다.

Did finish it. 

Story/storytelling: the main element of the whole game. As you would read a good book, youst you are a part of it.
The only thing in the story: it is really linear... You don't get a small sandbox, or even chapters, you can choose in any order, you have to exactly follow them...

Horror: the horror is not as visible as in the first two games, at first sigth the city in the clouds is a brigth, living and energetic place, where you would even consider to settle in. But after you dwell inside, you find many disturbing things... It is clearly no utopia...
Quite Simply, the most fun, non-politically-correct, mind blowing single player ''story shooter'' out there. Brilliant!
BioShock Inifinite is just enjoyable to play with.. Top notch game design and game dynamics. It's a breath taking experience. :D

By far one of the best games I've ever played!!! If not the best in my opinion. Rich and very deep story. A very interactive, action packed game play. Should get game of the year. Movie/game quality to put it simply.

One of the best first person shooters ever made. 

The city of Columbia is an absolute treat to explore, bursting with bright visuals. It's easy to get lost in the sky blues and brick oranges of the vibrant floating city. It oozes with atmosphere - Columbia is a game world unrivalled since perhaps Rapture back in the original Bioshock. Exploring every nook and cranny for supplies and audio recordings isn't something that you feel forced to do for an achievement, but rather something joyful as you soak in the game's lore. To speak too much of the story would be to venture into spoilery territory, but all that needs to be said is that it's compelling, layered and thought-provoking.

The shooting feels fast paced and frenetic, with certain encounters forcing you to think fast and utilise your arsenal as effectively as you can. Your companion, Elizabeth, helps you out by throwing you ammo and health kits when needed but don't worry, it never feels like a glorified escort mission as Elizabeth gets out of harm's way during combat. She's a help rather than a hinderence. 

Perhaps one of the only downsides is that compared to the original Bioshock, there isn't any sense of tension built up. Enemies such as the Crow Zealots could have perhaps created a sense of unease like the initial Splicer encounters in Bioshock did, but this is missing in Infinite.

Nonetheless, it's one of the best games you'll ever play. Dive in.

Amamzing visuals if you have the rig to run it at very high. Combat is fluid and jump around in the sky is a welcome addition to the gun&plasmid(vigor) play. If u play games and don't own this game then close your Steam account cuz you are missing out!!!

Probably one of my favorite games of all time.
Amazing graphics, story, and combat.

My only complaint is that the game ended.


Easily one of the most beautifully crafted video game story lines I have ever experienced.
i just started the game.. and the first look of it .... kust amazing grafixs and and gameplay....

An incredible story, spectaclular visuals and with gameplay that although mimics its predocessors, offers something very new and refreshing. BioShock Infinite is a first-person shooter in it's simplist description, where you weild a weapon and a super power or "vigor". But it's role playing elements like upgrading weapons and your vigors keep it fresh and challenging.

The story it self is one to be marveled at without a doubt. You follow Booker DeWitt (Troy baker; voice talent of Saints Row and The Last of Us) in 1912, a war verteran turn Pinkerton thug who has been offered a chance to wipe away his gambling debts by saving a nineteen-year old girl, Elizabeth, from the floating city of Columbia. In our current times we are seeing choice based games with silent protagonist the standard, it is almost like linear stories have become a lost art of sorts. But in Infinite we see a stong and brilliant characterisation with story telling so griping and so emotive you cannot put it down until it's finished.

The Bioshock series offers is a cross between Steampunk, American exceptionalism and thought provoking religoius discussions in an political and almost perfectly accessible way.

Bioshock Infinite é um jogo FPS diferente dos demais. O jogo conta a história de Booker DeWitt, um homem contratado para viajar para uma cidade aérea e resgatar uma jovem chamada Elizabeth (apelidade de Bete por mim). Bioshock Infinite conta com gráficos MUITO bons (Quer testar? Põe tudo no máximo). Uma trilha sonora muito boa e um enredo ótimo. Antes que você diga que Bioshock Infinite é só mais um jogo de tiro, saiba que a série Bioshock conta com uma carta na manga algo chamado: Vigores. Para você que não sabe vou te explicar o que é: É MÁGICA! Os vigores te permitem lançar várias "Magias" nos inimigos ( e até interagir com o cenário). Você pode queimar um inimigo, lançar um choque nele, mandar um ataque de corvos homicidas nele e etc.
Há também upgrades chamados infusões, que te permitem aumentar sua capacidade vida, escudo e sais ("munição" para os vigores).

DLCs: O jogo conta com 5 DLCs, Early Bird Special Pack, Clash in the Clouds, Columbia's Finest e Burial At Sea Ep 1 e 2. As DLCs Early Bird e Colubia's Finest são superfluas, apenas mais upgrades e skins novas para armas. 
 Clash in Clouds é basicamente 4 arenas com inimigos e objetivos a serem cumpridos. 
Agora Burial At Sea, é muito bão. O jogo se passa em Rapture (Cidade de Bioshock 1) e você é Booker detetive particular em Rapture (pois é). Certo dia uma tal de Elizabeth aparece em seu escritório, pedindo para você encontrar uma menina chamada Sally, aí o baguio fica loco. 

Mesmo com muita gente dando notas baixas a Bioshock Infinite, acusando-o de estragar a essência da série, eu gostei muito dele.

NOTA FINAL: 9.0/10.0

DLCs: Clash in the Clouds: 8.5/10
          Columbia's Finest e Early Bird: 7.0/10.0
          Burial At Sea: 9.5/10.0

Just as a political critique and a view into fundamentalism through American exceptionalism, Bioshock Infinite is worth playing. The level of detail in the setting, every object, every piece of art and recording, is marvelous. 
For those who had high expectations gameplay wise though, it may be a little bit of a let down. Don't get me wrong, it's still top notch as far as first person AAA games go, but considering the precedents it's a little bit reiterative and offers little innovation from previous installments.
Nevertheless, is a beauty, full of life and with an intriguing plot.

Muy buen juego desde el principio. Aún me queda mucha historia por pasar, pero es uno de esos juegos que desde el inicio quieres tener la oportunidad de tener un rato para jugar.

Muy recomendable.
Niestety nie miałem przyjemności zagrać dłużej w poprzedniczki tej produkcji, ale mogę śmiało zachęcić was do zakupienia danej gry. Bawię się razem z nią bardzo dobrze.

Solid FPS. Super smooth Unreal engine gives the game a near cinamatic feel. The action is intense and fast paced. The world does funnel you through a bit and at times that felt somewhat confining, especially compaired to an open world game like Skyrim.  The story line is hands down one of the best experiences in a video game I've had. I can't say enough about it. Just stunning!

The gameplay is nothing special. It's essentially Halo with magic. I was able to ignore this by focusing on the relationship between Booker and Elizabeth, which is genuinely well written, but my goodwill evaporated when the villain used his stereo system to siphon Elizabeth's power and turn his exwife into a ghost. The plot swandives into incoherence from there. The plot twists are predictable to anyone familiar with the tropes, easily guessed from the first ham-fisted bit of foreshadowing.

I give this game 5 stars. If you are wondering if the game is worth it, it is. Even at full price it is more then worth it.

This is a great game! My only complaint is you cant save when you want to. It only saves at checkpoints. The graphics are beautiful. The fight system is simple but not boring. Truly the best Bioshock game yet.
